ygData.subject: Re: limiting # of documents dowloaded per site
ygData.msgSnippet: Just tried this out.  It seems that the crawl never finishes .  Tried it on a single URL, limiting it to 10 docs for that site.  Once it reaches 10, it starts

Just tried this out.  It seems that the crawl never "finishes".  Tried
it on a single URL, limiting it to 10 docs for that site.  Once it
reaches 10, it starts giving -6000 as the status code for subsequent
pages, but the crawl never finishes, console just sits at "13 of 39
DOWNLOADED/QUEUED RATIO".  It also seems to count docs from
macromedia.com as part of the 10.  If I switch back to the default
frontier, it crawls the site and finishes.

seed: http://www.aptas.com
DomainSensitiveFrontier
HostScope
midfetch text/html content-type filter
Tom's filetype exclude filter

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> robeger wrote:
> 
> >
> > I know you can put a max number of documents for a crawl, but can you
> > set a max number of documents per site?
> 
> Take a look at the DomainSensitiveFrontier: 
>
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html.
 
> Here is from its description:
> 
> 41
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#41>
 / * Behaves like {@link HostQueuesFrontier} (i.e., a basic mostly
breadth-first frontier),/
> 42
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#42>
 / * but with the addition that you can override the number of
documents to/
> 43
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#43>
 / * download for a specific host or domain.  Useful for case of frequent/
> 44
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#44>
 / * revisits of a site of frequent changes.
> 
> St.Ack
> /
> 
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Rob Eger
